name: Internacional Design Hotel

reviews.title: Perfect location, style, and excellent service!
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved the modern style, free wifi, and helpful staff. The rooms were spotlessly clean. The location is perfect- close to many restaurants, two main squares, and many sights to see. The squares can be busy but with the double glass windows, I had no problem with the noise at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would not hesitate to stay there again!
reviews.title: They stand out from the rest, with flawless execution of everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and helpful. They took our tall requests and made it happen. You really feel they would bend over backwards if you ask them to. This is very important in a place like Lisbon where that is so very rare. It has such a funky modern design, and really great breakfast (also a very refreshing thing for Lisbon)! The rooms are comfortable and for such a busy bustling street, they are very quiet. Hats off- Nice work!
reviews.title: Trendy & Best Location

reviews.text: We booked this hotel from the reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed with our choice. The hotel is in the historic part of the city and even though the building is old, the inside of the hotel is not. Matter of fact the hotel is quite trendy. Our room was extremely modern, comfortable and quiet. Our room had a balcony that overlooked the square and walking street. The staff was very friendly and helpful with helping us enjoy the sites. We suggest to take Tram # 28 to get a great view of all the different areas of the city. The location of the hotel also made it easy to walk the city. It is a 10-15 minute walk to the water. The metro is a block away and it is easy to get to other parts of the city. One day there was music and dancers in the square near our hotel which we enjoyed. The breakfast was delicious. You can order a hot breakfast and still enjoy all the bread, meat, cheeses, cereal, yogurt and desserts. No need for lunch after this breakfast. When we return to Lisbon there is no doubt what hotel we will be staying at, The Internacional Design.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great - it's right by Rossio and an easy walk to most parts of town. There are also lots of restaurants/cafes etc. nearby. Staff at reception were incredibly friendly and helpful, and spoke brilliant English. They made sure I had everything I needed and really made my short stay completely hassle free as well as offering good advice on places to eat etc. The rooms themselves are themed, and I ended up in a Tribal room. I was initially a bit sceptical, as theme rooms can be badly done, but actually it was subtly decorated. Although not huge, the room was well designed and very comfortable. It had decent storage, a desk area, well equipped bathroom with powerful shower, comfy bed and free wifi. I thought minibar and room service prices looked reasonable too, compared to other hotels I've stayed in in Europe. The breakfast room was really beautiful - light, spacious and very sleek design. Breakfast was included in my room rate (which was just over 80 Euros, a good deal!) and had a great selection of savoury food, pastries, juices, fruit, yoghurt etc. It was very pleasant to look out over the square while enjoying breakfast.
reviews.title: Love love love!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from 5 nights at the Internacional Design hotel which i booked soley on the positive reviews on trip Advisor. I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is very central (on a narrow road between two large squares), very well designed - lots of artwork and soft lighting, all very clean and modern. We were on the Zen floor and our room, although hsmall, was perfectly adequate and had everything we needed. My only complaint was that there was no shelving in the bathroom and we ended up putting our things on the floor. our room faced the square at the front of teh hotel and after the first night we changed to a quiter room at the side of the building because I found the traffic noise kept me awake. There was no problem with us changing rooms, in fact, the hotel staff were always friendly and polite and spoke perfect English. Breakfast was included in our price and was excellent - plenty of choice, really good coffee (something many hotels can't seem to do well) and we really loved the mini custard tarts. The breakfast room is light and airy with lovely views towards the square.
reviews.title: Great hotel in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From Lisbon airport an airport shuttle bus costs 3 euros 50, on the way back to the airport there was no bus due to the Pope's visit and a taxi cost us less than 10 euros.
reviews.title: Great and beautiful hotel in the centre of Lissabon
Cool hotel - central location
reviews.text: I recommend this hotel for its convenient location, relaxed atmosphere and tasteful design. It is a 4 star hotel with 4 star facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has different kind of rooms in various sizes, depending on your budget. The rooms are beautiful, clean and practical. They are equipped with Wi-fi and come at an affordable price. Booking online even allows for substantial savings. The staff is very friendly, fluent in English and offer outstanding service. The hotel is located right in the city centre and is therefore ideal for exploring the city by foot. This is a five-star hotel at the price of a four- or even three-star.
reviews.title: Superb funky hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great value. Cool with the different themes. Also helful staff and great location in the heart of the city centre. I really liked it. If you can afford it (a bit expensive if you want to spend your money on something else than your hotel stay...not too expensive, but above average I would reckon...) try it:)
reviews.title: Great Location and Almost Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I truly recommend this hotel: It is central, nice and with an outstanding service.
reviews.title: Great , great, great hotel in central Lisbon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They live to the design in their name to the last detail: from the rooms decoration (every floor has a theme, we stayed in Urban an Pop floors. I prefer the urban concept but if you like pop culture that is a definite option).
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is great, with plenty of offer, eggs cook to order, nespresso coffee, fresh fruit and juices, and everything, from china to the cut of the fruit or the cheese cake "in a glass", whit a design twist that is not disturbing at all.
reviews.title: location, location, location & price

reviews.text: The final detail is their service. From the concierge to the restaurant, everyone is happy to help you. You never get a no.
reviews.title: Perfect location. Great service. Fun decor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, in Rossio Square, is unbeatable, two minutes from the Santa Justa elevators, trams, taxis and metro nearby and plenty of restaurants. Once the restaurants are close the area stays silent and safe, with all the central Lisbon charm that you don`t find in more modern areas of Avenida da Liberdade and without the incredible crowds and noise of Barrio Alto (5 minutes away by foot anyway).
reviews.title: Service and location second to none!

reviews.text: Good location and the staff were friendly. However this hotel is simply not up to standard for a Small Luxury Hotel of the World. There is no proper check-in desk so expect long delays checking in or out. The rooms are dreadful. Ours was a "large room" but was frankly tiny. The bathroom fittings were poor quality and the bath was too small to function as a bath, the less said about the shower the better. The internet facilty was not working either through a cable or wireless. Flat screen TV was about 14 inch and laughable. The rooms are noisy but this is probably an unavoidable function of the location. If you are on a very tight budget, get a good deal and don't expect too much then this maybe the hotel for you. If you expect a luxury hotel with fixtures and fittings to match then this most certainly is not a hotel you will enjoy.
reviews.title: Not up to standard for a Small Luxury Hotel of the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is in a great central location. It is a clean, functional hotel with basic facilities which served us well for a weekend break
reviews.title: Great location, clean with simple design
Great Hotel and great Location
reviews.text: This hotel is located right by the Rossio Metro and within walking distance to most everything in Lisbon. It is definately a unique hotel (i.e. we had pink toilet paper) but the service is great; anytime we had a question the staff was very helpful. They even gave us a laptop to use in the room which was nice. Also, the rooms and bathrooms are very clean.

I'd say the rooms are on the smaller side but definitely not an issue as I think you are really only in the room to relax and then just head right back out. The only drawback I would say about this hotel is that the entrance area/lobby is pretty small and did get a bit crowded at times but again, who cares about that. Check-in and check-out was a breeze also.
reviews.title: Beautiful and innovative hotel with great location
Good surprise
reviews.text: Overall I would stay here again if in Lisbon.

description: Enjoying the best possible location in Lisbon, this modern boutique design hotel is born, like a phoenix, from the ancient structures of one of the first luxury hotels in Portugal. The daring use of the colour Lilac in its façade, right on the traditional Rossio Square, denounce to the world the purposes of reinvention and exclusivity offered to a happy few.
